title: What is the power of fascination and how does eye contact affect brain activity?
first_phrase: In the previous text, we explored the first two levels of hypnosis research. Now, we delve into the deepest level, which holds the key to the most phenomenal results. We learn about brain waves and fascination, and how gazing at a fixed point can induce changes in consciousness. This section also touches on the effects of gaze fixation on brain function and how it can alter our perception. The text highlights research by Hess in 1972, which shows how eye convergence affects brainwave activity. The text then goes on to explain how similar changes in brain function occur during meditation practices where one gazes at a fixed point. The final segment discusses the broader implications of gaze fixation in interpersonal contexts.
content: Recenti ricerche scientifiche hanno dimostrato ad esempio come la convergenza oculare su di un punto preciso sia accompagnata da un diverso ritmo di onde cerebrali (Hess 1972). Continuando nella fissazione appaiono una serie di fenomeni di alterazione dell’attenzione e varie modificazioni della visione collegati probabilmente ad onde cerebrali di tipo delta o theta. Anche la fissazione interiore ha il suo effetto. Analoghi cambiamenti di funzionamento cerebrale avvengono quando, seguendo delle pratiche di meditazione diffuse tanto in oriente quanto in occidente, fissiamo la punta del naso oppure con le palpebre chiuse il punto tra i due occhi (cosiddetto “terzo occhio”). Ma il discorso è ancora più ampio in un contesto interpersonale.
last_phrase: In conclusion, recent scientific studies have demonstrated how fixing one's gaze on a particular point is accompanied by different rhythms of brain waves, leading to alterations in attention and vision. These same changes in brain function occur in meditation practices, and are also reflected in interpersonal interactions and animal behavior. The power of fascination is not exclusive to humans, as animals also possess this ability, which can elicit unusual responses from their prey or other creatures. Understanding the mechanics of fascination can provide insight into how we interact with the world around us.
